author: David Kelly
title: Ranked challenges for Arizona Soccer
text:
Ranked challenges for Arizona Soccer Posted: dkelly@tucsonnewsnow.com TUCSON, AZ - 
No. 17 Arizona is set to host 23rd-ranked California (Friday at 7 p.m.) and fifth-ranked Stanford (Sunday at 11 a.m.) this weekend at Mulcahy Stadium. 
The match against the Golden Bears has been selected as the White Out match and the first 200 fans will receive a free Arizona Soccer White Out t-shirt. 
Defender Sheaffer Skadsen was awarded the Pac-12 Defensive Player of the Week after she helped lead the defense to their fifth clean sheet of the season in their 1-0 victory against then ranked No. 21 Washington. 
Skadsen played every minute of the match for the eighth time this season. She has played in 809 of the 823 minutes this season and has also added a goal to her resum√©, when she scored the equalizer against Texas Tech in the 89th minute back on Sept. 11. 
The Wildcats took a big jump in all three rankings this week. Arizona checks in at 17th in the NSCAA Coaches Poll, 13th in the TopDrawer rankings and 16th in the RPI. 
Midfielder Gabi Stoian in just two seasons has put herself on several UA all-time lists. The Sophomore is tied for fifth in goals scored (18), fourth in assists (12), fifth in points (48), tied for fifth in game-winning goals (6) and tied for seventh in shots (105). 
As of late, goalkeepers Lainey Burdett and Rachel Estopare have been sharing the load in the cage. In the last four games, they have each started two of them. Burdett has played 535 minutes and Estopare has played 198 minutes. 
So far this year, the defense has only allowed four goals in nine matches played, which equates to just under 823 minutes of action. Those four goals allowed are tied for the fewest of all time in the first nine matches of a season (2004). 
10 players have scored 18 goals for Arizona, which is already tied for the third most in school history. On that same note, Oregon State and UCLA have only scored 10 goals while Oregon has scored six.
